title: Matrix Modeling - high school language study

content.question: At a certain high school, students are required to study Spanish or French during each of their four years in high school. Students may switch languages between school years but must take the next appropriate level in that language. Past data have shown that among year-one, year-two, and year-three students, those who study Spanish in a given year switch to French <math alttext="20 percent sign"><mn>20</mn><mo>%</mo></math> of the time, and those who study French in a given year switch to Spanish <math alttext="40 percent sign"><mn>40</mn><mo>%</mo></math> of the time. In a given year, there are a total of <math alttext="257"><mn>257</mn></math> year-one, year-two, and year-three students studying Spanish and a total of <math alttext="337"><mn>337</mn></math> year-one, year-two, and year-three students studying French. Which of the following best approximates the total number of these students studying each language the following year?
